author: ssh4098
content: NEAR has something similar as well (see https://github.com/near/NEPs/issues/40 for discussion and https://github.com/near/NEPs/tree/master/specs/Economics#state-stake for current model)

author: .vbuterin
content: Staking for storage is actually very economically misaligned

author: .vbuterin
content: Because it means that anyone with a lot of tokens can just come and grab a bunch of state for free

author: .vbuterin
content: And there is a lot of uncertainty over how much state gets used; in the worst case it could be a huge amount

author: .vbuterin
content: hmm I read both of those above docs just now

author: .vbuterin
content: I'm still convinced that the long-epoch expiry model (ie. what I proposed) is better than rent
